info.description: Parameters are stored as dictionaries mapping parameter names to their properties. Now supports optional/default parameters, parameter ordering, numeric suffixes, custom formatting, variadic arguments, and query/set duality.
notes: arguments and responses lists are ordered.
arguments and responses of type str may have a values list for accepted values
arguments and responses of type int or float may have a range parameter for min and max
If a command supports a numeric suffix, it will have 'numeric_suffix': true and a 'suffix_argument' index.
If a command supports variadic arguments, the last argument will have 'variadic': true.

*CLS.help: Clear Status - Clears the Standard Event Register, Operation Event Register, Questionable Event Register, and Error Queue

*ESE.help: Event Enable - Programs the Standard Event Status Enable register bits (0 to 255)

*ESR?.help: Query the Standard Event Status Event register. Reading the register clears it

*IDN?.help: Identification query - Returns manufacturer, model, serial number, and firmware version

*OPC.help: Operation Complete - Sets OPC bit when all pending operations are complete

*PSC.help: Power-on Status Clear - Controls service request generation on power-on (0/OFF or 1/ON)

*RCL.help: Recall - Restores electronic load to a previously stored state (0 to 9)

*RST.help: Reset - Resets the electronic load to factory-defined states

*SAV.help: Save - Stores the present state of the electronic load (0 to 99)

*SRE.help: Service Request Enable - Sets the Service Request Enable Register (0 to 255)

*STB?.help: Status Byte query - Reads the Status Byte register

*TST?.help: Self-test query - Returns 0 if passed, non-zero error code if failed

STAT:QUES:EVEN?.help: Query the questionable event register. Reading clears the register

STAT:QUES:COND?.help: Query the questionable condition register (real-time status)

STAT:QUES:ENAB.help: Set the questionable enable register (0 to 32767)

STAT:OPER:EVEN?.help: Query the operation event register. Reading clears the register

STAT:OPER:COND?.help: Query the operation condition register (real-time status)

STAT:OPER:ENAB.help: Set the operation enable register (0 to 65535)

MEAS:VOLT?.help: Query the average DC voltage at the load input

MEAS:VOLT:MAX?.help: Query the peak voltage at the load input

MEAS:VOLT:MIN?.help: Query the minimum voltage at the load input

MEAS:CURR?.help: Query the average DC current at the load input

MEAS:CURR:MAX?.help: Query the peak current at the load input

MEAS:CURR:MIN?.help: Query the minimum current at the load input

MEAS:POW?.help: Query the average power at the load input

LED:VOLT.help: Set LED forward voltage Vo (0.001 to MAX V)

LED:CURR.help: Set LED rated current Io (0 to MAX A)

LED:RCO.help: Set LED resistance coefficient Rd Coeff (0.001 to 1)

OCP:IST.help: Set OCP test start current (MIN to MAX A)

OCP:IEND.help: Set OCP test end current (MIN to MAX A)

OCP:STEP.help: Set OCP test current step count (1 to 1000)

OCP:DWEL.help: Set OCP test single-step dwell time (0.00001 to 0.99999 s)

OCP:VTR.help: Set OCP trigger voltage level (MIN to MAX V)

OCP:RES:PMAX?.help: Query PMAX value - Returns power, voltage, and current

PEAK:VOLT:MAX?.help: Query the maximum recorded voltage during peak test

PEAK:VOLT:MIN?.help: Query the minimum recorded voltage during peak test

PEAK:CURR:MAX?.help: Query the maximum recorded current during peak test

PEAK:CURR:MIN?.help: Query the minimum recorded current during peak test

INP:SHOR.help: Set short circuit function state (0/OFF or 1/ON)

FUNC.help: Select input mode: CURR, VOLT, POW, RES, DYN, LED, or IMP

MODE.help: Select input mode (equivalent to FUNC): CURR, VOLT, POW, RES, DYN, LED, or IMP

VOLT:RANG.help: Set voltage range (MIN, MAX, or specific value in V)

VOLT:ON.help: Set voltage of sink current on (V)

VOLT:OFF.help: Set load start unloading voltage (MIN to MAX V)

VOLT.help: Set/query voltage for a given channel (VOLT1 12.0, VOLT2 5.0, etc.)

CURR:RANG.help: Set current range (MIN, MAX, or specific value in A)

CURR:SLEW.help: Set slew rate for all current changes (MIN to MAX A/µs)

CURR:SLEW:RISE.help: Set current slew rate for positive transitions (MIN to MAX A/µs)

CURR:SLEW:FALL.help: Set current slew rate for negative transitions (MIN to MAX A/µs)

CURR:PROT.help: Set current protection level (MIN to MAX A)

CURR.help: Set/query current for a given channel (CURR1 2.5, CURR2 1.0, etc.)

POW:PROT.help: Set power protection level (MIN to MAX W)

POW.help: Set power in CP mode (MIN to MAX W)

RES.help: Set resistance in CR mode (MIN to MAX Ω)

DYN:HIGH.help: Set high-level load current in dynamic mode (MIN to MAX A)

DYN:HIGH:DWEL.help: Set duration of high-level load current in dynamic mode (MIN to MAX s)

DYN:LOW.help: Set low-level load current in dynamic mode (MIN to MAX A)

DYN:LOW:DWEL.help: Set duration of low-level load current in dynamic mode (MIN to MAX s)

DYN:SLEW.help: Set current slope in dynamic mode (MIN to MAX A/µs)

DYN:SLEW:RISE.help: Set current rising slope in dynamic mode (MIN to MAX A/µs)

DYN:SLEW:FALL.help: Set current falling slope in dynamic mode (MIN to MAX A/µs)

DYN:MODE.help: Set working mode in dynamic mode: CONT, PULS, or TOGG

DYN:SEQ.help: Set dynamic sequence with variable number of steps (DYN:SEQ 1.0,2.0,3.0,...)

SYST:ERR?.help: Query the next error from the error queue. Returns error number and message

SYST:LOC.help: Set the load to local mode (front panel control enabled)

SYST:REM.help: Set the load to remote mode (most front panel buttons disabled except LOCAL)

SYST:RWL.help: Set the load to remote mode with all front panel buttons disabled

TIME:VOLT:LOW.help: Set start rising voltage for voltage rise time measurement (0 to MAX V)

TIME:VOLT:HIGH.help: Set starting drop voltage for voltage fall time measurement (0 to MAX V)

TIM.help: Start or stop timing test (0/OFF or 1/ON)

TIM:LOAD:SETT.help: Determine whether to change load setting during timing test (0/OFF or 1/ON)

TIM:LOAD:MODE.help: Set load mode during timing test: CURR, VOLT, POW, or RES

TIM:LOAD:VAL.help: Set load parameter for timing test (units depend on TIM:LOAD:MODE)

TIM:TST:SOUR.help: Set trigger source for starting test: VOLT, CURR, or EXT

TIM:TST:EDGE.help: Set trigger edge for start test: RISE or FALL

TIM:TST:LEV.help: Set trigger level for start test (units depend on TIM:TST:SOUR)

TIM:TEND:SOUR.help: Set trigger source for ending test: VOLT, CURR, or EXT

TIM:TEND:EDGE.help: Set trigger edge for end test: RISE or FALL

TIM:TEND:LEV.help: Set trigger level for end test (units depend on TIM:TEND:SOUR)
